title: 111_hr5348
content: The Act titled "Federal Workforce Reduction Act of 2010" aims to reduce the number of federal employees. Section 3101 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include a hiring freeze for Executive agencies during fiscal years with projected budget deficits. The President will establish a Federal workforce hiring pool for appointments in all agencies. The President may appoint an individual to a position in an agency if there is a position available in the Federal workforce hiring pool, the agency head submits a request to the President, and the President approves the request. The President will establish regulations for the process and criteria for approving requests. The Federal workforce hiring pool will start with zero positions as of the first day of fiscal year 2011. The number of positions will increase by .50 for each vacant position in an Executive agency and decrease by 1.0 for each approved request for a position under this subsection. Waivers may be granted in cases of emergency or to protect. The President may waive the hiring restrictions in cases of emergency or national security concerns. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will oversee this process, consulting with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The President must report to Congress every quarter on approved appointments by executive agency. The President must report to Congress quarterly on approved appointments by executive agencies, with the list available to the public on the official website of the Executive Office of the President. This requirement excludes the Department of Defense, Homeland Security, and Veterans' Affairs.
